text: Cornuata is an extinct taxon of jawless fish that lived in the Early Silurian to Late Devonian. Life reconstruction of Zenaspis pagei == Overview of families == * †Benneviaspidae * †Cephalaspidae * †Dartmuthiidae * †Kiaeraspidae * †Sclerodidae * †Superciliaspididae * †Thyestidae * †Tremataspidae * †Zenaspidae * Genus inc. sedis: †Ilemoraspis == References == * Sansom, Robert S., Rodygin, Sergei A., & Donoghue, Philip C. J. 2008; "The Anatomy, Affinity and Phylogenetic Significance of Ilemoraspis Kirkinskayae (Osteostraci) from the Devonian of Siberia" Journal of Vertebrate Paleontology 28(3):613–625 == External links == * Category:Osteostraci Category:Paleozoic jawless fish Category:Vertebrate subclasses Category:Silurian first appearances Category:Devonian extinctions
title: Cornuata
